ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: A few hours to go through the readings. More for the weeks with an assignment.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This course seemed like an afterthought at some points in the semester. I wished we started with more "straightforward" assignments instead of jumping straight into analysis, as we did not know what was expected from us. I enjoyed the seminar aspect of this course with experts of each field giving lectures on their fields.

The strengths of the course are the different topics each week and the guest lecturers that come in. Weaknesses are the sometimes tenuous connection with "measurement issues" that need to get forced in to make the topic relevant for almost two hours.
Strengths: measurement issues in different fields Weaknesses: learning to critique a paper earlier in the semester
one strength of the course is that it provided an introduction to a variety of topics

This course is a great overview of a range of issues in the field. I appreciated the diversity of topics and how each lecture connected back to a common theme. I thought the final project was also a great way to bring together many of the topics talked about.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Excellent instructor. Very responsible

Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Dr. Lichtman is great with feedback and working with students. She encourages great and in-depth conversation and overall, I think she does well handling a (required) class that may not be everyone's favorite just because of the material.
Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Strengths: cares about students, good critiques, will learn a lot

Instructor: Judith Hilevi Lichtman  Professor Lichtman is wonderful! This course could easily be very dry, but she is able to make it incredibly engaging and interesting. She works hard to make sure the students get something out of the course and it shows. She is incredibly busy but it was clear that teaching to her was a priority.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class is very similar to what the CDE seminars are every week (especially when they're back-to-back on Thursdays). The topics are hit or miss mostly due to the broad coverage and whether or not you find a particular topic interesting.
Great course for learning measurement issues
